title: Matter & Atoms Practice Exam
description: Test your knowledge of atoms, matter, and the periodic table

questions.question: Which subatomic particle has a positive charge?
questions.explanation: Protons are positively charged particles located in the nucleus. Electrons are negative, and neutrons have no charge.

questions.question: The atomic number of an element equals the number of neutrons in its nucleus.
questions.explanation: The atomic number equals the number of protons, not neutrons. Mass number = protons + neutrons.

questions.question: An atom has 17 protons and 18 neutrons. What is its mass number?
Matter that has a definite shape and volume is in the _______ state.
questions.explanation: Solids have both definite shape and volume because particles are tightly packed and only vibrate in place.

questions.question: Which of the following is a compound?
questions.explanation: Water (H₂O) is a compound because it contains two different elements (hydrogen and oxygen) chemically bonded. The others are elements.

questions.question: Electrons are found in the nucleus of an atom.
questions.explanation: Electrons orbit the nucleus in electron shells or clouds. The nucleus contains only protons and neutrons.

questions.question: What is the density of an object with a mass of 80 g and a volume of 20 cm³?
How many total atoms are in one molecule of carbon dioxide (CO₂)?
questions.explanation: CO₂ has 1 carbon atom and 2 oxygen atoms, for a total of 3 atoms.
